body_content.explanation: in a high position and away from water, especially as it comes closer:
examples: If the drought continues, environmentalists fear that the streams will evaporate and the eggs from the spawning salmon will be left high and dry.
Even as the tide rolled in, the lifeguard sat high and dry in his chair.

body_content.explanation: in a very difficult situation without any help:
examples: Cuts to the educational budget have left many school arts departments high and dry.
The residents of the earthquake-torn city found themselves high and dry because the governor did not approve a disaster relief package.
